params.name: sortFunction
params.description: CF2016+ or Lucee5.1.0.13+ a function with two arguments each corresponding to a query row. The function returns -1 if first row is less than second, 0 if equal, or 1 if first row is greater than second. Lucee4.5+ accepts a column name to sort by instead of a function.

params.name: direction
params.description: Lucee4.5+ Only supported on Lucee when second argument is a column name instead of a callback function.

lucee.notes: Lucee also supports `querySort(query, column_name [, direction])` syntax. As of 5.1.0.13 it accepts a callback function. When called as a member function query.sort() is chainable.
